title: Attendance 1 - 06 Sep
author: firebird
content: Welcome to COMP2633. This is your first attendance flag. :D

tags.name: Week 1: Basic Training 1
tags.description: The basics of Linux, and some pretty powerful tools that come along with it.

title: Exercise 1-1: Regex101
author: firebird
content:
_Find the flag._

https://files.firebird.sh/chal-2024/01/regex_ex.txt

The flag has the following feature:

1.  Encoded in flag{...}

2.  Inside the {}, the length is 31

3.  Inside the {}, the characters are either number or alphabet except the twenty-first character

4.  Inside the {}, the third character is either “p”, “o”, “w”

5.  Inside the {}, the eighth character and the tenth character are the same as the third character

6.  Inside the {}, the seventh character and the fifteenth character are the same as the nineteenth character

7.  Inside the {}, the first character is not number

8.  The twenty-first character is "_"

tags.name: Week 1: Basic Training 1
tags.description: The basics of Linux, and some pretty powerful tools that come along with it.

title: Homework 1-1: Finding grepo
author: firebird
content:
I'm too lazy. Help me look for my flag! The flag is in the path in`~/questions/HW1-1` on [https://intro.firebird.sh/shell](https://intro.firebird.sh/shell)

If you can't connect to the shell, you can download the whole directory [here]
(https://files.firebird.sh/chal-2024/01/HW1-1.zip)

Conditions:
* The flag begins with `flag{` and ends with `}`.
* The flag is 33 characters long (including the "flag{}")
* The 31th char is either `G`, `R`, `E`, or `P`.
* The 8th and 16th char are non-alphanumeric, but there are still 2 non-alphanumeric characters hidden inside. `UwU`
* The 18th and the 27th char are of the same characters but are also case-insensitive.
* The 14th and 24th char are the same.

Note 1: There are no `/` in the flag

Note 2: For some special regex, you may need a pearl or just use our shell `:o`

author: Jackylkk2003
content:
You have seen ECB, CBC, CTR and other modes. Can you crack AES-UWU?

---

Hint: You may want to draw an image visualizing what AES-UWU is doing before you start the attack.

Probably not a hint: You can find the author through Discord if you are stuck at some point in the homework. Some hints may not necessarily be posted publicly to avoid spoiling the fun of solving challenges...

More hints [here](https://hackmd.io/@Jackylkk2003/6b-hw-hints).

title: Attendance 10 - 29 Nov
author: firebird
content:
Track A:

I used a large random integer to encrypt my flag so you cannot brute force it! Surely you can't get my flag.

title: Exercise 10-Bii: PFP-as-a-Flag
author: Jackylkk2003
content:
Did you know that, since the very beginning of COMP2633 this semester, the challenge author has stored a flag in his profile picture using the state-of-the-art flag storage algorithm called Local Storage Blocks?

And the author manages to compress the flag into very very small dots using a hydraulic press... Maybe you want to unpress it to see the flag?
